Who is helping keep Saudi Arabia’s warplanes in the air as they bomb Yemen—where children are dying of hunger in the worst humanitarian crisis on the planet?

The United States of America. That has got to stop. https://apnews.com/f1e148c0a70544ffa9a06c744e4240e7

Huge corporations like Amazon and Walmart don't want unions because unionized workers have higher wages, better benefits and more control over their lives.

Unions are the last line of defense against corporate greed.

That's why we're going to double union membership nationwide.

Sometimes tariffs are the only tool left to address unfair trade,but they aren’t ideal

But the fact that they are driving the creation of productive American jobs proves my point,public policy that furthers the common good isn’t a rejection of capitalism

https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-u-s-furniture-industry-is-backbut-there-arent-enough-workers-11575504528?emailToken=c429d60fe07e4b7ad8b53c9103e4b5321fY0/cabTJqQTGHy54CCVPP31uI/OTAJjPfQv3nMJHePa1nHAnKW050FQKxfxGT4IHhocEkzqVblgiZsOBe+GBFTqfXYnbt+IDLDOrKlHJqgiuCNF1TMAXKkgas9fwF2&reflink=article_copyURL_share

SNAP is our country’s most effective anti-hunger initiative. The USDA’s cynical new rule does nothing to close the income inequality gap and instead threatens to take food away from millions of Americans. House Democrats will not be silent. #HandsOffSNAP https://www.speaker.gov/newsroom/12419-0

Universal put money into this race, but if it’s a fight between money and the power of a grassroots movement, I'm betting on the people—and last night, the people won. Congratulations! I'll keep fighting with you for affordable housing for everyone. https://twitter.com/OrgFlorida/status/1201995438905315331 QT @OrgFlorida Today's Dist 6 runoff is key for a number of reasons. From @UniversalORL's $125M road expansion to the affordable housing crisis plaguing our state. Here's the rundown📝:

Thanks to grassroots groups like @OrgFlorida, Orlando voters chose people over corporations, defeated big money interests and delivered a big win for Bakari Burns. 

Together, we will address the affordable housing crisis in Central Florida and across the country. https://twitter.com/orlandosentinel/status/1202347137947897862 QT @orlandosentinel Burns wallops Siplin – and Orlando’s theme parks – in city council election | Commentary https://trib.al/N2wewga http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EK-YWYBW4AEERJa.jpg

Walmart’s CEO made 1,076 times more than the median Walmart worker last year.

The Walton family makes $70,000 a minute.

Don't tell me Walmart cannot afford to pay a living wage to every worker.

They choose not to out of greed.

It’s called momentum!!!

My #SunshineProtectionAct just gained ANOTHER co-sponsor! 😎

The evidence in the House Intelligence Committee’s report makes it clear: Trump’s scheme to pressure Ukraine was an abuse of power for his own political gain. This is precisely why our founders put impeachment powers into our Constitution.

Wealth of the entire American middle class: $36.9 trillion

We will tax their wealth to raise $4.35 trillion over 10 years, break up their power and give it back to the working class.

#OTD in 1967 Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. announced the Poor People’s Campaign—a new march on Washington bringing together Americans to demand better education, fair wages, and an overall higher quality of life. Today, that struggle continues—it’s on us to finish the fight.

“I believe in him, and he is the people that I grew up with. He is those working class people and I know that he’s got their backs because that’s who he is. What the establishment used to say about our ideas:

Raising the minimum wage to a living wage—too radical.
Guaranteeing health care to all—too radical.
Aggressively combating climate change—too radical.
Not having a super PAC—too radical.

None of these are "radical" anymore.
